text: Lode Van Den Bergh (18 June 1920 - 29 September 2020) was a Belgian writer. He was married to Nora Steyaert. He was born in Rijkevorsel. He used the pseudonyms Aster Berkhof and Piet Visser. He started his career as a monitor at the Catholic University of Leuven. He also worked as a teacher at the Royal Athenaea in Antwerp, Brussels and Koekelberg. Finally he became a professor at the Saint Ignatius Faculty in Antwerp.
